# SOURCE: Synthetic data based on NREL A: # DESCRIPTION: PV system specifications for agri-PV installation at 3 density levels
# LOGIC: All variants use same monocrystalline PERC panels (18.5% efficiency); density affects ground coverage and microclimate effects. Tilt optimized for 28N latitude. System losses include wiring
PV panel manufacturer specifications: and mismatch losses. Standard 400W panels (1.96 m2 each) used for calculations. Panels per kW = 1000 / panel_wattage_w. Degradation rate 0.5%/yr per IEC 61215 for mono-crystalline Si. Shading factor is annual average PV output reduction from agri-PV crop shading — higher density means more inter-row shading losses. temp_reference_c is the STC reference temperature (25C). tilt_factor is the irradiance gain from fixed tilt at 28N latitude (1.05 ≈ 5% boost vs horizontal). temp_adjustment_c set to 0 for all densities (daily-mean cell-to-ambient offset not modeled separately; temperature derating uses ambient air temp directly). irradiance_factor is the fraction of GHI reaching panel surface (currently 1.0 for all densities since panels are above crops).

# SOURCE: Synthetic data based on NREL A: # ASSUMPTIONS: Fixed-tilt south-facing installation; 3.0m clearance for agricultural equipment; hot desert environment increases soiling losses slightly; standard monocrystalline PERC panel wattage 400W; panel area 1.96 m2 per panel (typical for 400W mono-PERC)
# CONTEXT: Panel type: Monocrystalline PERC. Use case: Agri-PV installation. Standard sizes: Common panel sizes used in 2024.
